title: Correctional Officers as Truancy Officers (Hampden County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that detail the extent to which correctional officers and other Sheriff Department employees act as truancy officers from January 1, 2023 to the time this request is filled. Specifically, I request records that show the name and title of sheriff department employees who act as truancy officers, the school districts where they have worked, and any training or certification that the employee has received related to work as a truancy officer.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

title: FOIA Log FY2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Log FY2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request a copy of the FOIA log maintained by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. Specifically, I am requesting the log for the fiscal year of 2024 on the subject of urban flooding, flooding as a natural disaster and flood mitigation. 

If the log could please contain the following information:

The request number or tracking number.

The date the request was received.

A brief description of the records requested.

The name or office of the agency official responsible for the request.

The current status of the request (e.g., pending, completed, denied).

The final disposition or outcome of the request (e.g., released in full, released in part, denied).

If possible, could the log please be provided in a CSV / XLS accessible format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Britton Struthers-Lugo

title: Cybercheck communications & contracts

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Cybercheck communications & contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Chattanooga Police Department and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. Email exchanges, including attachments, between Chattanooga Police Department staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. Emails, including attachments, between staff of Chattanooga Police Department that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present. 

4. A copy of the 911 call audio and transcript related to the murder of 20-year-old Omar Escobar on Willow Street that took place on Sept. 27, 2021

I kindly ask that you waive all fees as I am a journalist making the request on behalf of a Canadian broadcaster and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest. (For further context, please see these news articles: https://archive.is/5FHPz and https://www.nbcnews.com/news/crime-courts/ai-tool-used-thousands-criminal-cases-facing-legal-challenges-rcna149607.) If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request. Please let me know if anything is unclear.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Jessica Hatcher.

title: Public Records Request – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Drone Footage (American Fine Art Gallery Burglary – Jan 7, 2024)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Drone Footage (American Fine Art Gallery Burglary – Jan 7, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of all video recordings—specifically body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and drone surveillance footage—related to the police response to a burglary in progress at the American Fine Art Gallery, located in Old Town Scottsdale, on the morning of January 7, 2024.

This incident involved the arrest of Harpreet Singh, who was apprehended on the roof of the gallery. Officers reportedly discharged pepper balls, deployed a K-9 unit, and used drone surveillance during the search and arrest. Body camera video shows officers giving verbal commands and locating burglary tools and high-value artwork on the rooftop.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from officers responding to the burglary call;

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles involved in the response;

Any drone footage used to locate or surveil the suspect;

A timeframe of approximately 5:30 AM to 8:00 AM on January 7, 2024;

Any associated audio dispatch or supplemental footage if available.

If any part of the request is unclear or too broad, I am happy to revise or narrow it. If redactions are necessary, I ask that the remainder of the footage still be released. Please notify me of any associated costs prior to processing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage (March 29, 2025 Incident Involving Theft of Chicken)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – Bodycam and Dashcam Footage (March 29, 2025 Incident Involving Theft of Chicken)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available body-worn camera and dash camera footage related to an incident that occurred on or around the morning of March 29, 2025, involving the arrest of a 50-year-old male suspect for residential burglary and violation of a protection order, reportedly involving the theft of a pet chicken named “Polly.”

News reports state the incident occurred in or near Port Orchard, and deputies located the suspect hiding in the woods. Bodycam footage reportedly captures deputies confronting the suspect as he yelled, “Don’t hurt my chicken,” and one officer replying, “I won’t hurt your chicken,” before placing the chicken in a patrol vehicle.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from responding deputies;

Any dashcam footage from patrol vehicles related to the pursuit, search, or arrest;

Footage beginning from approximately 9:00 AM to 11:00 AM on March 29, 2025;

Any supplemental audio or video recordings associated with the incident.

If redactions are necessary, I request that the remainder of the footage still be released.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Communications Between MIT Media Lab and Tech Companies (Google/Meta) Regarding Suppressed Research on Algorithmic Bias (2020–2021) (Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency — DARPA)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Between MIT Media Lab and Tech Companies (Google/Meta) Regarding Suppressed Research on Algorithmic Bias (2020–2021) (Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency — DARPA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request the following:  

1. All communications (emails, memos, reports) between MIT Media Lab researchers and employees of Google, Meta, or other tech companies regarding the study titled *"Racialized Disinformation in Search Algorithms"* (2020).  

2. Documents discussing the modification, suppression, or defunding of this study, including:  
   - Internal MIT Media Lab communications.  
   - Correspondence with external tech industry partners.  

3. Grant agreements or contracts between [Agency Name] and MIT Media Lab that reference research on "algorithmic bias," "search engine discrimination," or "racial disinformation" (2019–2021).  

This request is motivated by reports of suppressed research at MIT, including investigations by The Guardian (2021) and The Markup (2021).

I request these records in electronic format. If fees exceed $25, please notify me in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vaporeon

title: Communications Between MIT Media Lab and Tech Companies (Google/Meta) Regarding Suppressed Research on Algorithmic Bias (2020–2021) (National Science Foundation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Between MIT Media Lab and Tech Companies (Google/Meta) Regarding Suppressed Research on Algorithmic Bias (2020–2021) (National Science Foundation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request the following:  

1. All communications (emails, memos, reports) between MIT Media Lab researchers and employees of Google, Meta, or other tech companies regarding the study titled *"Racialized Disinformation in Search Algorithms"* (2020).  

2. Documents discussing the modification, suppression, or defunding of this study, including:  
   - Internal MIT Media Lab communications.  
   - Correspondence with external tech industry partners.  

3. Grant agreements or contracts between [Agency Name] and MIT Media Lab that reference research on "algorithmic bias," "search engine discrimination," or "racial disinformation" (2019–2021).  

This request is motivated by reports of suppressed research at MIT, including investigations by The Guardian (2021) and The Markup (2021).

I request these records in electronic format. If fees exceed $25, please notify me in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vaporeon

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] - Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Between MIT Media Lab and Tech Companies (Google/Meta) Regarding Suppressed Research on Algorithmic Bias (2020–2021) (National Science Foundation)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Sir or Madame.

While we have received the email below.  However, we are unable to proceed with logging this request without the first and last name of the requester.

Additionally, the National Science Foundation's mission is to advance the progress of science, a mission accomplished by funding proposals for research and education made by scientists, engineers, and educators from across the country.  As you have not specifically identified an award, we would have no way to properly perform a search for records.  The FOIA does not require agencies to create new records or to conduct research, analyze data, or answer questions when responding to requests.

Here is a link to our website so you will have a better idea of the types of records we maintain:

www.nsf.gov<http://www.nsf.gov>

For your convenience, I am enclosing a link to our award database:

https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/

You can also use the advanced search https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/advancedSearch.jsp to select a directorate and/or provide keywords to narrow your search.

At this time, your request is not considered perfected and therefore, we will not log it into our FOIA database.  If you identify an award from which you would like to receive information  as well and your full name, you may submit a new FOIA request.

Thank you for your interest in the National Science Foundation.

Arlene Marshall
Program Analyst
Office of the General Counsel
Office: 703-292-8038
Email: arlmarsh@nsf.gov<mailto:arlmarsh@nsf.gov>

U.S. NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION
2415 Eisenhower Ave, Alexandria, VA 22314, USA
[U.S. National Science Foundation logo.]<https://www.nsf.gov/>

title: Request for Records: Texas Man Arrested for Kratom Possession (March 30, 2024)

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Records: Texas Man Arrested for Kratom Possession (March 30, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting all records pertaining to the March 30, 2024, traffic stop and arrest of a Texas man near U.S. 35 and Interstate 69 in Grant County, Indiana, during which Indiana State Police discovered 500 grams of Kratom.

Please include:

Arrest report

Incident and investigative reports

Body-worn camera footage 

Booking or custody records

Laboratory analysis report on seized Kratom

Dashcam footage of the stop (if applicable)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

title: New York City Police Department: FOIL Metrics and Reports

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York City Police Department: FOIL Metrics and Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any weekly, monthly, or quarterly report concerning the number of pending or received FOIL requests. This request is limited to such reports generated on or after January 1, 2024.

2. Any annual report concerning either (a) the number of pending or received FOIL requests; or (b) any metrics relating to the length of time the Department takes to process or otherwise respond to FOIL requests. This request is limited to such reports generated on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth, Mayor's Office and Mattie Parker and Brooke Rollins (3.23.25-4.7.25)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth, Mayor's Office and Mattie Parker and Brooke Rollins (3.23.25-4.7.25)
communications.communication:
Hi Jaclyn,

Thanks for your help on my previous request (E003214-031825). Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Correspondence – including calls (phone, Zoom and Microsoft Teams), texts, emails and messages – between the Fort Worth City Council and Mayor Mattie Parker and the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) between 3/23/2025 and the date this revised request is received.

2) Correspondence — including phone calls, texts, emails and Microsoft Teams calls — from members of the Fort Worth City Council and Mayor Mattie Parker regarding the USDA or AG Secretary Brooke Rollins between 3/23/2025 and the new date this revised request is received.

Please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM.

Thank you

Bradford Davis

communications.subject: Public Records Request: Tue, 04/08/2025 - 20:09
communications.communication:
Good morning, Adam -


We are writing to acknowledge receipt of your public records request for
the following:


1. A copy of any policy concerning recognition or registration of student
organizations at your institution or at any institution within your
district.


*Response: *With regard to request #1, the Administrative Regulations and
Governing Board Policies of the Maricopa Community Colleges District
(MCCCD) are publicly available on the MCCCD website and may be viewed at
the following web links - Administrative Regulations
<https://district.maricopa.edu/regulations> and Board Policies
<https://district.maricopa.edu/board-operations/board-policies>.


2. A copy of any list of active or recognized student organizations at your
institution or at any institution within your district.



*Response:* With regard to request #2, a search will be conducted to
determine what records exist and that are responsive to your request.


3. A copy of any list of contact information for active or recognized
student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your
district.


*Response: *With regard to request #3, a search will be conducted to
determine what records exist and that are responsive to your request.



Please note that records requests are processed in the order received and
we will follow up with you directly upon completion of the search and
review of documents.



Thank you.
[image: Maricopa Community College District Office logo]

MARICOPA COMMUNITY COLLEGES
Office of General Counsel - Public Stewardship Services
2411 West 14th Street, Tempe, AZ 85281
public.records@info.maricopa.edu
https://www.maricopa.edu/

Mr. Steinbaugh:

  1.  A copy of any policy concerning recognition or registration of student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

Attached are the governing policies with regards to MCC’s Student Activity Council. Affiliated procedures can be found in our Student Life Handbook (https://catalog.mohave.edu/content.php?catoid=68&navoid=22845) under “Clubs or Organization Information”

  1.  A copy of any list of active or recognized student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

  1.  A copy of any list of contact information for active or recognized student organizations at your institution or at any institution within your district.

The primary staff contacts for student life, including student organizations, can be found on the right hand side of the above website<https://www.mohave.edu/life-at-mcc/clubs/>, along with a multitude of student resources. Each club has a list of its officers on their individual pages.
If you require any further information, please don’t hesitate to contact us again.

title: HOMELESS HOUSING SET-ASIDE Applications

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: HOMELESS HOUSING SET-ASIDE Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A list or summary of projects from January 1, 2020, to present that include units designated under the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy, 
including:

Project name

Developer

Number of set-aside units

Funding status (approved, pending, denied)

Any internal tracking documents, summary sheets, or compiled records maintained by the Mayor’s Office of Housing that reflect use or implementation of the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy.
This request does not seek full funding applications—only summary-level MOH documents.

For clarity, the Homeless Housing Set-Aside Policy referenced in this request is posted at:

title: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records pertaining to animal cruelty investigations and any related enforcement actions conducted by the Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Animal Health and Diagnostic Services, concerning the following:
▪︎ Anne Gibbs
▪︎ K9 Hero Haven, identified as #15949
▪︎ 176 Mahanoy Creek Lane, Herndon, PA 17830
▪︎ Information on the 'Mass Cull' of several working K9s who had resided at this facility that took place in February 2024 at Sunbury Animal Hospital
▪︎ Information on the Revocation of Anne Gibbs Kennel License
▪︎ Publicly Available Court Documents related to Anne Gibbs, her charges of animal neglect, and crimes committed on her property
▪︎ Records of Any K9s, CWDs, MWDs or other Dogs reported as 'Missing' from the property
▪︎ Medical records for CWD Cezar (German Shepherd), K9 Rex (Belgian Malinois), K9 Dondo, and K9 Sosa - (these are the 4 K9s who were in the care of PSPCA as of Nov 2024. These medical records are crucial to the adoption of these K9s)


This request encompasses, but is not limited to, all records of complaints received, inspection reports, investigative files, and any other documents generated or compiled by the Bureau in connection with said investigations. Specifically, the request seeks records covering the period from JANUARY 1, 2023, to the PRESENT DATE.

A waiver of all applicable fees associated with this request is respectfully requested. The disclosure of these records is crucial to myself, as I am the current adopter of a Contract Working Dog (CWD) that Anne Gibbs had her in possession for a period of time. I state 'Her Possession' because to refer to it as 'Care' would do a disservice to CWD Cezar. He was one of the 28 K9s that were seized from her property, and rescued from PSPCA, where he remained until I adopted him. In addition, this case is  demonstrably in the public interest, as it pertains to potential animal cruelty within an animal rescue organization. The release of this information would significantly contribute to public understanding of the oversight and operations of such organizations, thereby promoting animal welfare and fostering accountability within the community. This request is not predicated upon a commercial interest, but rather seeks to ensure the welfare of animals and promote transparency in the handling of animal cruelty complaints.

Expedited processing of this request is respectfully requested due to the potential ongoing nature of the alleged animal welfare concerns and the necessity for prompt action. Animal cruelty investigations are inherently time-sensitive, and delays in access to pertinent information may adversely affect ongoing investigations and the safety and well-being of the animals involved. There are several posts on Anne Gibbs public social media page, which I believe, are possible indicators of continued neglect.

I currently serve as a K9 Handler in the Private Sector, along with a branch of the Department of Defense. I am a Nationally Certified K9 Handler, with extreme knowledge and certification of these working K9s.  I am also still serving as a member of the United States Army, as a Military Police Officer. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on USB/CD-ROM. I can provide the CD-ROM/USB if requested. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Very Respectfully,

Julia Valenti
CPT, MP
Commanding

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Valenti

title: April 2025 Letters about TikTok from DOJ to Apple and Google

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: April 2025 Letters about TikTok from DOJ to Apple and Google
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request to the Department of Justice (DOJ) Mail Referral Unit. Please refer this request to all of the DOJ components likely to have responsive records.

On April 6, 2025, Bloomberg reported that "Apple Inc ... on Saturday [April 5, 2025] received a letter from Attorney General Pam Bondi telling the company it should follow President Donald Trump’s executive order that will extend the pause on a TikTok ban in the US, according to people with knowledge of the matter." Please refer to the attachment for an excerpt of the article, which is published at: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-06/apple-keeps-tiktok-on-its-store-after-assurances-from-ag-bondi/.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The April 2025 letter about TikTok from DOJ to Apple Inc, described above.
2. Any similar April 2025 letters about TikTok from DOJ to Alphabet Inc. or its subsidiary Google LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay fees for this request up to a maximum of $200. If you estimate that the fees will exceed this limit, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Tan

title: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Haralson County Board of Elections and Registration)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Haralson County Board of Elections and Registration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska
